snippet: Reeva Steenkamp, who was shot by the sprinter Oscar Pistorius, had big plans for her newfound fame, including speaking about violence against women in South Africa, friends and family said.
abstract: Stunned South Africans are debating whether Reeva Steenkamp, who was shot by the sprinter Oscar Pistorius, died from the same scourge of domestic violence she was hoping to fight, or if she became tragic victim of a national fixation on crime and self-defense; friends and family say she had big plans for her newfound fame, including speaking about violence against women.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and LYDIA POLGREEN

lead_paragraph: Reeva Steenkamp, who was shot by the sprinter Oscar Pistorius, had big plans for her newfound fame, including speaking about violence against women in South Africa, friends and family said.

headline.seo: South Africans Debate Meaning of Reeva Steenkamp’s Death
headline.main: South Africans Seek Meaning in a Shooting
headline.print_headline: South Africans Seek Meaning In a Shooting
